translated: Birth Stories
Ten-&-One Collection
The Chapter on the Four Gates
The Mahādhammapāla Birth Story
“What is your vow? What is your spiritual life?
What is the result of your good practice?
Tell me, brahmin, the meaning of this,

original: Kasmā nu tumhaṁ daharā na miyyare”.
analyzed: kasmai nu tumham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: why you young people do not die.”
“We live righteously, we don’t lie,
we avoid bad actions.
We avoid all that’s ignoble,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare.
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: that’s why we young people do not die.
We listen to the Dhamma, good and bad,

analyzed: na ca api dhammam asatam rocayāma
translated: but we don’t approve of the bad Dhamma.
We leave behind the bad and don’t abandon the good,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare.🔽Pubbeva dānā sumanā bhavāma,
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare  pubbā iva dānā sumanāḥ bhavāma
translated: that’s why we young people do not die.🔽Before giving, we’re happy;
while giving, we’re even happier;

analyzed: da tvā api ve na anutappāma pacchā
translated: and after giving, we’re not remorseful,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare.
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: that’s why we young people do not die.
Monks, brahmins, and those of higher status,
merchants, beggars, and the poor—
we satisfy them with food and drink,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare.
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: that’s why we young people do not die.”
We do not transgress our wives,
Nor do our wives transgress us.
We live the spiritual life apart from them,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare.
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: Therefore we do not die young.
We all abstain from killing living creatures,
In the world we avoid what is not given.
We do not drink liquor or speak falsely,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare.
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: Therefore we do not die young.

original: Etāsu ve jāyare suttamāsu,🔽Medhāvino honti pahūtapaññā;
analyzed: etāsu ve jāyare suttamāsu  medhāvinaḥ honti pahūta paññā
translated: Sons are born to them who are the best of women,🔽They are wise, have great wisdom,
Are learned and know the Vedas,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare.
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: Therefore we do not die young.

original: Mātā pitā ca bhaginī bhātaro ca,
analyzed: mātā pitā ca bhaginī bhātaro ca
translated: Mother, father, sister, brother,

original: Puttā ca dārā ca mayañca sabbe;
analyzed: puttā ca dārā ca mayañca sabbe
translated: Sons, wives, and all of us,
We live righteously for the sake of the next world,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare.
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: Therefore we do not die young.
Slaves, slave women, dependents,
Attendants, and all workers,
They live righteously for the sake of the next world,

original: Tasmā hi amhaṁ daharā na miyyare”.
analyzed: tasmai hi amham daharāḥ na miyyare
translated: Therefore we do not die young.”
“The Dhamma indeed protects one who lives by the Dhamma,
The well-practiced Dhamma brings happiness,
This is the advantage of well-practiced Dhamma,
That one who lives by Dhamma does not go to a bad destination.
Dhamma indeed protects one who lives by Dhamma,
Like a great umbrella in the rainy season;
Protected by Dhamma, my son Dhammapāla,
The prince is happy with the bones of another.”
The Mahādhammapāla Jātaka is the ninth.
